post.body: I'm curious to see if there's more going on here than on Twister. Everyone there was slowly drifting towards ZeroNet.

Does / will ZeroMe implement any safeguards against harassment and abuse etc.? This is something that comes up when I mention blockchain social media on Twitter etc. since that is a very large part of many people's experience and a libertarian environment does not attract those who feel most vulnerable even where they acknowledge the benefits of not having a company or intermediary constructing their realities.

comment.body: I'll try and take a look at that. It sounds interesting, but I am concerned about the manipulation of uninformed voters that tends to take place with features of direct democracy, and about the trend towards illiberal outcomes.
